dempred.datastructure

Class DatasetManipulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dempred.datastructure.DatasetManipulator

  • public class DatasetManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class DatasetManipulator contains various methods to manipulate existing datasets.

      • generateFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void generateFeatures(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                          FeatureGeneratorInterface<T> featureGenerator)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Given a dataset this function generates features using a featureGenerator interface. Previously existing features in the dataset will be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Dataset Type
        Parameters:
        dataset - Dataset to generate the features for
        featureGenerator - the feature generator used to generate the features
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • generateFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void generateFeatures(T datapoint,
                                          FeatureGeneratorInterface<T> featureGenerator)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Given a datapoint this function generates features using a featureGenerator interface. Previously existing features in the datapoint will be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Datapoint Type
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the datapoint to generate the features for
        featureGenerator - the feature generator
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • squareFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void squareFeatures(Dataset<T> dataset)
        Given a dataset this function squares all existing features in this dataset: f1,f2,f3 will be squared to f1*f2,f1*f3,f3*f3,f1,f2,f3
        Type Parameters:
        T - Dataset Type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset

      • squareSingleFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void squareSingleFeatures(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                              int featureIndex)
        Given a dataset this function squares a single feature at the specified index position.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Dataset Type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset to be processed
        featureIndex - index of the featre to be squared

      • addFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void addFeatures(Dataset<T> dataset,
                                     FeatureGeneratorInterface<T> featureGenerator)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function adds all features defined by a featureGenerator interface to a dataset. Existing features will not be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Dataset Type
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset
        featureGenerator - the feature generator used to generate the features
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • addFeatures

        public static <T extends Datapoint> void addFeatures(T datapoint,
                                     FeatureGeneratorInterface<T> featureGenerator)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This function adds all features defined by a featureGenerator interface to a datapoint. Existing features will not be overwritten.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Datapoint Type
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the datapoint
        featureGenerator - the feature generator used to generate the features
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception

      • getFeatureVectors

        public static FVector[] getFeatureVectors(Dataset<?> dataset)
        Given a dataset this function returns an array of FVectors. Each containing the features of a single datapoint. The returned array is a fresh copy of the features not a simple reference to the original ones.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset used to extract the feature vectors
        Returns:
        the feature vectors

      • getFeatureMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FVector> getFeatureMap(Dataset<?> dataset)
        Returns a HashMap containing all features of all datapoints for a featureName.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the input dataset
        Returns:
        a feature HashMap

      • getFeatureVectors

        public static FVector[] getFeatureVectors(Dataset<?> dataset,
                          FeatureSubset subset)
        Returns an array of FeatureVectors (FVecors) containing all features defined by a subset.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset
        subset - the subset of features which should be extracted
        Returns:
        the feature vectors
